thread.title: People are 'theft-proofing' their Apple AirPods by disguising them as floss
thread.title_full: People are 'theft-proofing' their Apple AirPods by disguising them as floss

author: Jerico Mandybur
title: People are 'theft-proofing' their Apple AirPods by disguising them as floss
text:
Social media users were quick to mock Apple's AirPods when they were first unveiled back in September , calling them electric toothbrush heads and their containers, dental floss dispensers.
But who's laughing now, huh? AirPods enthusiasts, that's who. It seems that the dental hygiene similarities have an upside: Disguise.
Yep, some AirPod users have begun creating stickers to deter would-be thieves from rolling them for their expensive wireless headphones.
SEE ALSO: Teardown might just reveal why the AirPods were delayed for so long
Just look at these innovative DIY jobs, made to look like dental floss packaging.
Theft proof your Apple Airpods pic.twitter.com/FW495FdevL
‚Äî Georgia üñá (@Georgia_Dow) December 31, 2016
Made my AirPods theft-proof! pic.twitter.com/w67daBdjAx
‚Äî Chris Siglos (@ChrisYourWords) December 31, 2016
Pre-designed stickers are even being sold on Etsy for $7.10, which is a bargain considering if you lose them, they're $69 each to replace. Ouch.
Just charging my dental floss.
‚Äî #Apple #AirPods pic.twitter.com/XSVxZq4oZL
‚Äî Joel Barron (@JBTech17) December 20, 2016
But with great ideas come great risk. In this case, the risk of losing your AirPods altogether, because you thought they were old dental floss and throw them in the trash.
Has anyone seen my white dental floss case...aka...AirPods? I can't find them. Seriously. üëøüçé
‚Äî Brian Tong (@briantong) December 21, 2016
Not to mention the fact that now thieves may become extra vigilant when it comes to checking those floss dispensers.
Well, it was good while it lasted.
[h/t Gizmodo ]
